title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]

HDG.BC.content: does most said in saying keep its essence secret? [why name Being?], Being keeps its essence silent, as silence, origin of language > the animal doesn’t speak: silence is impossible for it > language stands in essential relation to uniqueness of Being [Being needs man]

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.DL.content: many a man could be drawn into prologue (Vorspiel) of a messenger-course, if he keeps himself ready (bereithält) [prepares] for a dialogue of language > take some steps along a course (Gang), which entrusts (anvertraut) itself to the Wesen of Saying, which promises (zusagt) > let’s be glad if it not only seems so but is so [hope of arrival?] > what then? the farewell (Abschied) of all “It is (Es ist)” comes to pass (ereignet sich)

HDG.LP.content: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

HDG.LP.content: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: [spirit & soul] spirit drives soul in das Unterwegs, carries soul over to strangeness > soul is gifted (beschenkt) w/ the soul > spirit is the animator (Beseeler) [cf. p. 181 pain animates] > but soul guards the spirit, “feeds” it, no spirit w/out soul: soul invests spirit w/ flame (its very nature), the glow of melancholy (Schwermut), “the patience (Sanftmut) of the lonely (einsamen) soul”

HDG.LP.content: beneath the one semblance is concealed the Einfalt of pain, flaming the furthest when holds to itself most intimately [beholding vision] > pain as Grundzug of great soul, in pure harmony w/ holiness of blue: “blue shines upon the soul’s face by withdrawing into its own depth” > holy is present (west)/endures (währt) only by keeping w/in this withdrawal (in diesem Entzug verhält), turning vision toward fitting (Fügsame) [via flame of pain]

HDG.LP.content: poet’s work is only a listening, it’s language becomes a saying after (nachsagenden) > poetry’s spoken word guards Gedicht, as that which remains, essential in it, unspoken > when the saying-after must listen, becomes more pious, i.e. fügsamer gegenüber dem Zuspruch des Pfades [more fittingly submissive re: the promptings of the path] [traces?]

HDG.LP.content: land: open region that promises & guards a dwelling (Wohnen) > Trakl’s land is older, more promising than Platonic-Christian land (European West): apartness is “first-beginning” of mounting world-year (steigenden Weltjahres), not abyss of decay

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

HDG.WL.content: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]

HDG.EC.content: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death

HDG.EC.content: your experience of healing now heals me, letting us become those who wait > the far is near in the nearness of what is held in reserve (Aufbehaltenen), the farness (Ferne) of what is dear (Holden) > for those who wait, the difference (Unterschied) btwn near/far opens most purely > those who wait will guard themselves from hastening to know that which heals in itself

HDG.OHF.content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]
